bwwExcerpt: [The show]Â seems a bit much in two acts, and contains some business I don't understand...He's endearing when he speaks about his career, self-depricating when he speaks about himself and especially his relationship with a father who both intimidated and infuriated him, and who has left and indelible mark on his psyche. When it comes to revealing his home life Leguizamo is more like an old pal than you may want - he may just be giving you a little too much information.
